page.title: 11INDUSTRY NEAR WYDDIAL
page.content: A chalk quarry on the eastern edge of the block is in Anstey parish.Owned and worked by Pertwee Landforce,it covers 16 acres and has been in production since 1914.Originally the chalk was dug by hand and carted by horses.Later a large steam engine was installed.Since 1945 all is dug and moved by tractor.Today it produces up to 20,000 tonnes of chalk per year.This is used for agricultural chalk and is delivered over about 300 square miles. Flints are also quarried.These are used for knapping,mainly for the repair of old churches and other buildings.Originally there were glass works that used flint in Hare Street 3 miles south,but these no longer exist.The quarry employs 5 people.Flint Cottages on the edge of the block were built from this Quarry.
